page.title: 02Education,New Galloway
page.content: There is one Primary School in New Galloway, namely, Kells Primary. It is a three teacher unit with a present roll of 60 pupils. Kells Primary has a wide catchment area, taking, not only the village children, but also those whose parents work for the Forestry Commission at Clatteringshaws and the Bennan.Almost half the children have to be transported to school. The school involves many members of the community in its Project work. The I.Q.of the children is above average and they costantly show their talents in sport and music at Regional and National Festivals. The children transfer to Dalry Secondary School, two Kilometres away. Here the children work to "O" Grades and then they transfer to Kirkcudbright Academy for "A"Levels.
